name: Taman Ayodya
description: Taman Ayodya is one of the famous parks in South Jakarta. Located near Blok M, this park offers various recreational facilities such as children's playground, jogging area, and green open spaces for relaxation with family and friends.

name: Museum BNI 46
description: Museum BNI 46 is a historical museum located in the Sudirman area of South Jakarta. The museum showcases collections of artifacts and historical objects related to banking and the economic history of Indonesia, as well as provides information about the development of banking in Indonesia.

name: Taman Langsat
description: Taman Langsat is a popular public park in South Jakarta. Located in the Kebayoran Baru area, this park is a popular destination for residents to relax, exercise, or simply enjoy the natural beauty amidst the city.

name: Ragunan Zoo
description: Ragunan Zoo is the largest zoo in Jakarta, located in South Jakarta. Known for its extensive collection of animals, Ragunan Zoo is a favorite destination for tourists and families to spend time together while learning about various animal species.

name: Pasaraya Grande
description: Pasaraya Grande is a famous shopping center in South Jakarta. Offering a variety of goods from fashion, food, to household items, Pasaraya Grande is a popular shopping destination in the heart of Jakarta.

name: Ancol Dreamland
description: Ancol Dreamland is a popular recreational complex located in North Jakarta. It offers various attractions such as amusement parks, beaches, water parks, and an oceanarium, making it a favorite destination for families and tourists.

name: Mangrove Ecotourism Center
description: Mangrove Ecotourism Center is an educational and recreational destination in North Jakarta. Visitors can explore the mangrove forests through boardwalks, participate in conservation activities, and learn about the importance of mangrove ecosystems.

name: Taman Impian Jaya Ancol
description: Taman Impian Jaya Ancol is a waterfront entertainment complex in North Jakarta. It features a variety of attractions including a theme park, waterpark, beach, and wildlife conservation area, providing entertainment for visitors of all ages.

name: Museum Sejarah Jakarta (Jakarta History Museum)
description: The Jakarta History Museum, also known as Fatahillah Museum, is located in the Old Town area of North Jakarta. It showcases the history of Jakarta through various artifacts, dioramas, and historical objects, providing insights into the city's rich heritage.

name: Pulau Kelapa (Kelapa Island)
description: Kelapa Island is a historical and cultural destination located in North Jakarta. Visitors can explore the remnants of Dutch colonial buildings, visit historical sites such as the Maritime Museum and Sunda Kelapa Harbor, and learn about Jakarta's maritime heritage.

name: Taman Mini Indonesia Indah (TMII)
description: Taman Mini Indonesia Indah (TMII) is a cultural and recreational park located in East Jakarta. It showcases the diversity of Indonesia's culture and heritage through various traditional pavilions, museums, and attractions representing each province of Indonesia.

name: Pulau Bidadari (Bidadari Island)
description: Bidadari Island is a small island located off the coast of East Jakarta. It offers pristine beaches, clear waters, and opportunities for snorkeling and diving, making it a popular destination for day trips and water sports enthusiasts.

name: Taman Mini Aquatic Center
description: Taman Mini Aquatic Center is a water park located within the Taman Mini Indonesia Indah complex in East Jakarta. It features various water attractions, slides, and pools, providing fun and excitement for visitors of all ages.

name: Kampung Betawi Setu Babakan
description: Kampung Betawi Setu Babakan is a cultural village located in East Jakarta. It preserves the traditional Betawi culture and lifestyle, offering visitors a glimpse into the indigenous culture of Jakarta through various cultural performances, workshops, and culinary experiences.

name: SnowBay Waterpark
description: SnowBay Waterpark is a themed water park located in East Jakarta. It offers a variety of water slides, wave pools, and other attractions, providing a fun and refreshing escape from the city's heat.

name: Taman Anggrek Mall
description: Taman Anggrek Mall is one of the largest shopping malls in West Jakarta. It offers a wide range of shopping, dining, and entertainment options, including a cinema, indoor ice skating rink, and a variety of international and local brands.

name: Museum MACAN (Modern and Contemporary Art in Nusantara)
description: Museum MACAN is a contemporary art museum located in West Jakarta. It showcases a diverse collection of modern and contemporary art from Indonesia and around the world, providing a platform for cultural exchange and artistic appreciation.

name: Old Town Jakarta (Kota Tua Jakarta)
description: Kota Tua Jakarta, also known as Old Town Jakarta, is a historical district located in West Jakarta. It features colonial-era buildings, museums, and cultural attractions, providing a glimpse into Jakarta's rich history and heritage.

name: Central Park Mall
description: Central Park Mall is a mixed-use development located in West Jakarta. It features a shopping mall, office towers, hotels, and a large urban park called Central Park, providing a vibrant and modern destination for shopping, dining, and entertainment.

name: Taman Anggrek Residences
description: Taman Anggrek Residences is a residential complex located in West Jakarta. It offers modern apartments with various facilities including swimming pools, fitness centers, and landscaped gardens, providing a comfortable living environment for residents.

name: National Monument (Monas)
description: The National Monument (Monas) is a famous landmark located in Central Jakarta. It stands as a symbol of Indonesia's struggle for independence and offers visitors panoramic views of the city from its observation deck.

name: National Museum of Indonesia
description: The National Museum of Indonesia, also known as Museum Nasional, is located in Central Jakarta. It houses an extensive collection of artifacts, relics, and artworks representing the diverse cultures and history of Indonesia.

name: Merdeka Square (Lapangan Merdeka)
description: Merdeka Square, also known as Lapangan Merdeka, is a historic square located in Central Jakarta. It is surrounded by important landmarks such as the National Monument (Monas), National Museum, and Istiqlal Mosque, making it a significant cultural and political hub.

name: Istiqlal Mosque
description: Istiqlal Mosque is the largest mosque in Southeast Asia, located in Central Jakarta. It is a symbol of religious tolerance and harmony, welcoming visitors of all faiths to admire its grand architecture and serene atmosphere.

name: Museum Bank Indonesia
description: Museum Bank Indonesia is a museum located in Central Jakarta, housed in a heritage building that was formerly the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Bank. It showcases the history of banking and currency in Indonesia through various exhibits and artifacts.
